intro: Psammetes, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, showcasing its adaptation to dry environments. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, which helps reduce water loss. Psammetes is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in challenging, low-maintenance conditions.
